newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 3.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 3.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Shares rose Wednesday as the market welcomed a deal which saw Cable & Wireless Plc double its stake in Optus Communications Pty Ltd. Cable & Wireless paid A$980 million for the 24.5 percent stake of Bell South Corp. Analysts said the deal valued Mayne's stake at about A$1.0 billion and moved along the Optus float, although this is now seen unlikely in 1997.

Market waits on decision by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission on Westpac's proposed A$1.4 billion bid to merge with Bank of Melbourne. Newspapers have quoted sources close to the talks as saying the merger will go ahead. A decision has been expected for some weeks.

Advanta Corp, rumoured to be a NAB takeover target, is being sued by shareholders for concealing information from investors while executives banked A$52 million from selling the company's stock, the Sydney Morning Herald reported. Analysts said the suit was positive for NAB, given the damage to Advanta's share price.
